DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma PSMA PET Scan N Stage Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Based on PSMA PET scan, the extent of the regional lymph node involvement for prostate carcinoma based on evidence obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter)

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Carcinoma PSMA PET Scan N Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of the most common malignant tumors afflicting men.  The majority of carcinomas arise in the peripheral zone and a minority occur in the central or the transitional zone of the prostate gland.  Grossly, prostatic carcinomas appear as ill-defined yellow areas of discoloration in the prostate gland lobes.  Adenocarcinomas represent the overwhelming majority of prostatic carcinomas.  Prostatic-specific antigen (PSA) serum test is widely used as a screening test for the early detection of prostatic carcinoma.  Treatment options include radical prostatectomy, radiation therapy, androgen ablation and cryotherapy.  Watchful waiting or surveillance alone is an option for older patients with low-grade or low-stage disease._A positron emission tomography imaging technique that uses the PET-sensitive drug, 68Ga-PSMA-11, to bind to cancer cells and locate cancer lesions.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Property.preferredDefinition: One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To T2 Stage Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways._A general term that refers to a TNM finding of primary tumor growth beyond the level of in situ cancer, minimal subepithelial invasion, or minimal greatest diameter. The definition of T2 TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to primary tumor that is more than 2.0 cm, but not more than 5.0 cm in greatest dimension; for cutaneous melanoma it refers to primary tumor that is 1.01 to 2 mm in thickness, with or without ulceration; for colorectal cancer it refers to primary tumor with invasion into the muscularis propria; and for bladder cancer it refers to primary tumor with invasion into the muscle layer.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.

A general term that refers to a TNM finding of primary tumor growth beyond the level of in situ cancer, minimal subepithelial invasion, or minimal greatest diameter. The definition of T2 TNM finding depends on the specific type of cancer that it refers to; for example, for breast cancer it refers to primary tumor that is more than 2.0 cm, but not more than 5.0 cm in greatest dimension; for cutaneous melanoma it refers to primary tumor that is 1.01 to 2 mm in thickness, with or without ulceration; for colorectal cancer it refers to primary tumor with invasion into the muscularis propria; and for bladder cancer it refers to primary tumor with invasion into the muscle layer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.1 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001995. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding usually indicating that the cancer is locally invasive, without infiltration of adjacent structures.

Concepts.definition: A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding usually indicating that the cancer is locally invasive, without infiltration of adjacent structures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding indicating direct invasion of adjacent structures by cancer.

Concepts.definition: A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding indicating direct invasion of adjacent structures by cancer.
